messages: 7ff0a5e0307d848b29d5f4ae07bd7346 (17:05): smbclient -M localhost works fine. smbclient -L mymachine works fine. smbclient -M mymachine -> connection failed
8030d6b411d67db028b85cee7aa80de6 (17:09): eikke: nmblookup -A mymachine, does mymachine 0x03 present in list?
7ff0a5e0307d848b29d5f4ae07bd7346 (17:10): looking up 127.0.0.1, no reply from same ip
8030d6b411d67db028b85cee7aa80de6 (17:11): mymachine and localhost is the same machine,
7ff0a5e0307d848b29d5f4ae07bd7346 (17:12): not set, looks like default is wins lmhosts bcast ?
7ff0a5e0307d848b29d5f4ae07bd7346 (17:14): no reply from 127.0.0.1. nmblookup -A on my LAN IP also results in a no reply message
7ff0a5e0307d848b29d5f4ae07bd7346 (17:15): strange thing is -M on localhost works, not on machine name
8030d6b411d67db028b85cee7aa80de6 (17:15): canyou connect by telnet localhost 139 and telnet localhost 445?
7ff0a5e0307d848b29d5f4ae07bd7346 (17:16): I havent got a firewall, only one on my wan gateway
8030d6b411d67db028b85cee7aa80de6 (17:17): ok, this is name resolve order. ))
7ff0a5e0307d848b29d5f4ae07bd7346 (17:18): then why does smbclient -L mymachine work fine?
7ff0a5e0307d848b29d5f4ae07bd7346 (17:18): looks like it tries broadcast lookup when I -M mymachine
8030d6b411d67db028b85cee7aa80de6 (17:22): may be you try to restart nmbd?
8030d6b411d67db028b85cee7aa80de6 (17:23): you restart nmbd and now all work?
7ff0a5e0307d848b29d5f4ae07bd7346 (17:24): init script gave no errors after doing a restart (which should if the service wasnt running)
8030d6b411d67db028b85cee7aa80de6 (17:25): i don't know, how to say, that "no thanks" ^_^
8030d6b411d67db028b85cee7aa80de6 (17:25): my english is not cool at all.
7ff0a5e0307d848b29d5f4ae07bd7346 (17:26): heh, its ok, I'm not native either
8030d6b411d67db028b85cee7aa80de6 (17:26): try to read logs before lines about restart.

1e7aa0ac658a816d907be1998c963b3a (17:34): can anyone point me into the right direction with my problem? i have write access on the share and can do anything i want. there is just the problem, that i cant read a file that is actually written too by a process on the linuxmachine. i found something about file lockings but it didnt help me so far ...
